pgTitle: List of museums in New Mexico

rows.text: A:shiwi A:wan Museum and Heritage Center
Formerly the Tularosa Basin Historical Society Museum
Albuquerque Museum of Art and History
Art of the Southwest and over 400 years of Albuquerque history
Live snakes, snake art, exhibits and memorabilia
History, science, and art of ballooning and other lighter than air flight
website, exhibits include Native American artifacts, period kitchen, children's items, farm & ranch display, oil & gas industry
Visitor center museum features exhibits about the ruins of several ancestral Pueblo structures
website, located at B-Square Ranch, includes antique electrical, radio, communication, industrial and agricultural artifacts
website, located at B-Square Ranch, wildlife mounts in dioramas from 5 continents
History of Fort Sumner and the Bosque Redondo Indian Reservation
website, local history exhibit and changing cultural exhibits
Visitor center features exhibits about the volcano and the area's geology, natural and cultural history
website, includes local and regional history, Native American art and artifacts, and modern, contemporary and Southwestern art
website, exhibits include mining equipment, rocks, bottles, tools, insulator, coffee can, hand grinders & antique collections
website, operated by the Sacramento Mountains Historical Society
website, operated by the Columbus Historical Society
Features reconstructed kiva ruins, prehistoric and historic Indian and Spanish colonial artifacts
Heritage railroad with rolling stock on display
Eastern New Mexico University Natural History Museum
E.I. Couse Historic Home and Studio
El Camino Real International Heritage Center
Visitor center features exhibits about the cultural and natural history of El Morro
El Rincon Trading Post and Museum
information, store with museum display of Native American and Western artifacts
Science museum with interactive exhibits for children
Ruins of three forts and visitor center with exhibits, seasonal living history programs
Ruins of the mid 19th century Army post with exhibits on frontier and military life
Florence Hawley Ellis Museum of Anthropology
website, art and culture, operated by the Southwest Indian Foundation
website, natural and cultural history of Sierra County, includes fossils, Apache artifacts, Hispanic heritage, ranching, mining, Mimbres and Tularosa pottery, frontier history, military displays
533-acre (2.16 km2) national monument with ruins of interlinked cave dwellings built in five cliff alcoves by the Mogollon peoples, visitor center and museum of Apache and Mogollon artifacts
Home of New Mexico's first governor, also features gallery of Western art
website, history, art and customs of the Acoma
website, located next to Veteran's Memorial Park
Historic and contemporary art and culture of the Taos region
website, operated by the Union County Historical Society
Historical Center for Southeast New Mexico Museum
website, 1912 home with first floor furnished for the period, second floor with local history displays
Hubbard Museum of the American West
website, local and regional arts, history and culture, collection includes horse gear from around the world, and carriages, wagons and horse-drawn vehicles spanning hundreds of years
Jicarilla Arts and Crafts Shop Museum
information, information, basketry, beadwork, paintings, leatherwork, and other arts and crafts
Las Cruces Museum of Nature and Science
website, railroad history of Las Cruces and the impact of the railroad on Southern New Mexico
website, complex include a 1918 hotel, 1908 Love House, 1914 school, store and post office, dugout, 1950 Reed House
Western town with 17 historic structures, 6 open as museums
Former late 19th century Roman Catholic church with helix shaped spiral staircase
Los Lunas Museum of Heritage and Arts
website, local history and art, branch of the Los Lunas Public Library
Prehistoric history of the Southwest, early humans, and other anthropology exhibits
Art and culture of historic and contemporary Northern New Mexico
Museum of Indian Arts and Culture
Art and culture of southwestern Native Americans
Includes folk art, popular art, toys, ceramics, carvings and textiles from more than 100 nations
website, Hispano art forms, operated by the Spanish Colonial Arts Society
Art and culture from Hispanic communities
National Museum of Nuclear Science & History
Scientific, historic, and cultural aspects of the Atomic Age, formerly the National Atomic Museum
New Mexico Bureau of Geology & Mineral Resources Mineral Museum
New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology
New Mexico Farm and Ranch Heritage Museum
State’s 3,000-year history of farming and ranching
The New Mexico Film Museum program was discontinued in 2010.
History of the Holocaust, genocides and forms of bullying that have affected people around the world
New Mexico Museum of Natural History and Science
Fossils and geology, astronomy, personal computer history
New Mexico Museum of Space History
Displays related to space flight and the space age, includes the International Space Hall of Fame
New Mexico School for the Deaf Museum
History of over 100 years of education at the New Mexico School for the Deaf
New Mexico State University Art Gallery

website, information, exhibits include mining and railroad equipment, blacksmith shop, vintage autos and trucks, firefighting equipment, medical office equipment, farm equipment, homemaking and carpentry equipment
Important events, ideas, and themes in New Mexico's past
Includes ruins of the Pecos pueblo and a mission church, historic adobe ranch home and a visitor center with exhibits
Includes volcanos, archeological sites and an estimated 20,000 carved images
Philmont Museum and Seton Memorial Library
information, history, culture and art of the Picuris
website, information, 1880s general store with intact furnishings and merchandise, mining tools and equipment
Arts and culture of the Pueblo people, especially the Tewas of northern New Mexico
website, egional artifacts associated with ranching, coal mining, railroads, and pioneer life, also New Mexican art
website, exhibits on the prehistoric Anasazi and the present-day Zuni, Hopi and Navajo
website, operated by the Gallup Historical Society
Art and history of the American Southwest and beyond, includes fine art, decorative arts, Robert H. Goddard Collection of Liquid-Propellant Rocketry, planetarium
website, vintage and classic automobiles, Route 66 memorabilia
Visitor center features exhibits about the ruins of the mission churches and pueblo of the monument
11th century Chacoan great house and museum
information, late 18th century former adobe church, displays of New Mexican santos (carved images of the saints), Italian Renaissance paintings, and Mexican baroque paintings
information, information, artifacts, art, photos and memorabilia about the space program and space

website, folk art creations featuring thousands of miniature, wood-carved figures including animated little people, instruments, animals and objects, miniature Western towns, carnivals, Old West memorabilia, old-fashioned arcade machines, dolls, antique tools and more
Features scale model and miniature railway trains
website, turquoise mining, specimens, shaping process, uses
University of New Mexico Art Museum
History of gliding in the western United States
Tours of the astronomical radio observatory, consisting of 27 radio antennas in a Y-shaped configuration
website, history, art and customs of the Towa
Western Heritage Museum & Lea County Cowboy Hall of Fame
Western New Mexico Aviation Heritage Museum
Wheelwright Museum of the American Indian
Contemporary and historic Native American art
website, exhibits include history of America's missile and space development, Atomic Age, scientists, outdoor missile park
Visitor center features exhibits about the natural and cultural history of the desert
Zuhl Museum: Home of the Zuhl Collection
